Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: hart4july
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable during our stay at this La Quinta Inn, The location is right on the 5 Freeway, but just 2-3 blocks from Old Town so the convenience is worth it. The rooms are atiny bit grungy around the edges, and the beds are a bit hard but overall a nice clean standard 2 Queen bed room. The staff was really nice and accommodating, offering free short term garage parking for our visiting guests. The breakfast was free and quite decent, though it was over at 9 which I think is too early for a tourist location. We wanted to sleep in but could not, as we had to feed our family for free. I would recommend this hotel, a good place to stay and walk to Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: wildjflippin
Reviews.Content: Needed a value priced hotel near old Town for just one night. This hotel fit the bill quite well, 3 blocks from OT, good location. Room small but very clean and nice, Bed was good, pillows soft. Free breakfast was fine. Had waffles, fruit, juice and coffee. Lady at the front desk very personable and helpful. All in all, good place for Old Town stay

Reviews.Title: “Way too noisy”
Reviews.Author: jmt99892
Reviews.Content: I will say that the staff was very friendly and helpful and that most of the things were fine, given the location and the (relatively low) price. However, the biggest problem was the noise of the room (107). I checked in and was told what the room number was. By the time my wife and I and our dogs were in the room and settled in, we realized how noisy it was going to be (being right next to I-5). It didn't help that other hotel guests above us were somewhat noisy and that we could hear a decent amount of noise coming from the pool area. It was nice that someone (I'm guessing one of the hotel front-desk workers) called us that evening to see how things were going. We mentioned the noise, and she nicely said she was sorry, noting that we could have been given a different room "If we (the hotel) just would have known" (that the noise of that room was going to bother us so much). Again, she was very nice, and I'm not sure what else I would have said in that situation if I had been her. However, I'm not sure what type of guest would be fine with a room like that--I don't think anyone would be able to sleep very well in that room. I realize that there is not much that can be done about the noise of those rooms, short of a full-scale overhaul. However, I will mention two smaller things that I think could be improved: 1) The TV was not very good. It's not that it has to be some newer, flat screen or something. But, the sound was distorted at times, and the remote was hard to use to control the volume. When we would hit "Volume Up" or "Volume Down", the volume would change by 5 or so notches each way, making it difficult to keep the TV at a volume that we were able to hear from bed, but that didn't hurt our ears. (We eventually just got up and changed the volume by hand.) 2) The bedding smelled very strongly of chlorine or something like that. I stay at a lot of mid-level hotels (like La Quinta), and I haven't experienced a smell that strong. So, sorry to be picking on so many things, but that's an honest review. Again, the hotel personnel were great, so I can't fault them at all. And, there was no pet fee, which was a huge plus for us. I wouldn't stay here again, though, purely because of the noise level.

Reviews.Title: “10 dollars to park”
Reviews.Author: Professional99
Reviews.Content: I respect that the hotel recommends you use their parking due to the low light street parking and the concern of crime, but 10 dollars seems excessive. Also a full size car barely fits into the spots in the parking spots. AAA and most web based services fail to mention this 10 fee which is a shame . Hotel is only a 15-20 min walk to the heart of Old Town and a 10 -15 min walk to the tip of the tourest area, but the walk from the hotel is not well lit ... so have street smarts if you go out at night. The is hotel airport shuttle service, but only at the top of the hour. Internet is weak. Some food and ther garbage piles in the halls

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good price, a decent place.......”
Reviews.Author: DarrenJonesOC
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on Hotwire for a one night stay (the day before we went to Sea World). In sum, if you pay $100 or less per night for this hotel, I can sort of recommend it, but you should not pay more. Location: a reasonably brief walk to Old Town though you cross into a couple of block of low lit streets on your way there, and you do have very quick access to the 5 fwy and are only minutes from Sea World and downtown SD. Parking: not near enough.......they were kind and did let us park overnight in the 'check-in' spot since the undergound garage was totally full (we checked in at 7pm), I am not sure what the people who checked in later than us did for parking?? There is a smallish but clean pool and spa in the central courtyard and the room itself...totally basic. Average maintenance, furnishings and cleanliness. There was a continential breakfast included, but we already had breakfast plans so I can't comment on that. In sum, average place in all regards, so price becomes the key decider as to whether to stay there or not.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: My_lover_boy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LaQuinta for a health conference I was attending - there was a bus which was arranged to pick us up at this hotel and bring us back so we stayed here...even though there are other choices in the area. It is a little tricky to see the entrance from the road so go slowly if you are driving. The parking garage was never packed so there was never a problem...and it was under ground to boot. Checking in and checking out was wonderful, with very friendly folks. Our room was adequate and clean....and meeting staff in the halls was always pleasant with "good morning" or "good evening". We did not have breakfast there so can't comment on that. Be sure to ask for a room not facing the highway. We faced the pool area which was in a festive mood (expected) in the evenings, but quieted down by 10:30 so no issue here. We will actually be in San Diego in April for a couple of days and will be booking here again because of the location....oh, yes, make sure you go to the "old town", yes a walk up a little hill, but we are not out of shape like some people who complained about it so it didn't bother us. The very friendly folks at the front desk make wonderful restaurant recommendations. We ate too much...but we will go back in April. :) For the price you pay for a room, there is value. We usually stay at the Four Seasons, but we did not expect Four Seasons luxury so keep that in mind. The friendly staff however was on par though.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, old hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Kellie B
Reviews.Content: I must be missing something. I see all these wonderful reviews and my experience was the opposite. My husband and I stayed this past Saturday night. We arrived at 7:30pm only to find out that the parkling gargage was already full. Great. Where to park? I call the front desk to ask for suggestions and they are no help. Finally we find street parking and carry our belongings up the street to the hotel. The check-in process was pleasant. We get to our room, It's a very basic, old hotel room. Feels pretty run down and not so clean. Bummer. We try to use our cell phones. Service is terrible. Can't make a call. We try to use the free wireless. Can't connect. We call the front desk, and are given an 800 number to call for assistance. After 4 attempts with the guy at the 800 number we give up. Unable to connect to the interenet and plan our next day. Very frustrating. Would I stay here again? Absolutely not. There are far too many choices in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, average room, great service! Good price.”
Reviews.Author: silvertips
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior hallways look old and tired. The room is spacious but average looks and furniture. The service was excellent from front desk employees Alex and Grace. The complimentary breakfast service and food was a pleasant surprise. The location is close to Old Town, and the selection to restaurantin in Old Town are limitless. Try the old town mexican cafe, great for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The bargain, service and location makes this place worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flick21
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our stay at La Quinta Inn Old Town. The rooms were lovely and clean. Very comfortable beds and and amenities. Our stay was made even better by Alex on the front desk who was more than helpful in his suggestions for places to eat in Old Town and was really friendly which is something you don't always encounter on the front desk. The complimentary breakfast was the BEST we have encountered in the States. So much variety, especially the waffles and the bagles. We loved our stay here and would definitely stay here again. Very easy access to the freeway with our hire car.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value”
Reviews.Author: topknot_nyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, and has been remodeled, but that being said, the place is a fantastic bargain. The rooms are clean, with a spotless frig, microwave, and coffeemaker. Breakfast is plain, but with a waffle maker, lots of fruit, and it's free. The hot tub and the pool are clean, and the pool, in January, is perfectly heated. It's quiet. Wifi worked well, and it is free. Lots of towels, comfortable bed, location near (very touristy) Old Town. From other reviews, I was worried about the basement parking. Yes, it's tight. You may have to discharge your passengers before parking (there are big columns in the way) but if you are courteous and park between the marked spaces, it's not a problem, even with a Suburban. Staff couldn't be nicer. Only complaint: No one to help with bags...but they provide a cart. Great discovery: Super efficient taxi service...619 444-4444. They arrive immediately and their computer calls your cell to tell you they are there. The suite is fabulous--there's a work area in a living room with a sofa bed with the bathroom in between, and a second television. If you require Ritz Carlton glitzy, this may not be for you. We thought it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: bmax101
Reviews.Content: Decent La Quinta well situated to stroll Old Town, shuttle to and from airport, catch public transportation to just about anywhere in San Diego. Courtyard design around pool and hot tub nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Loud, cramped parking, not a business class hotel, low-class place”
Reviews.Author: Robear46
Reviews.Content: Parking is very tight. The people staying here are low-lives that smoke up the smoke-free hotel, yell at each other at all hours, and bring their barking dogs with them. Not a business class hotel when you have a terrific choice in the area. The wifi doesn't work on portable phones. The staff is very nice but is limited to what they can do.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate. Nothing to write home about, but clean”
Reviews.Author: YepBeenThere
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a king room for 1 night. The room was clean and was decent size, has a micro/fridge combo, 32â€� flat screen. The bed was hard and the pillows were cheap. The work desk is small with only one outlet and the chair was sub-par. There is light traffic noise from the expressway that didnâ€™t bother me, but may if youâ€™re a light sleeper. Has pool and whirlpool which I did not use. Price for room was good, BUT add in $10.00 for parking and itâ€™s not as good of a deal. The shuttle only runs until 8:00 pm, so I had to rent a car or pay for a taxi to the property. $16.00 cab ride plus tip. This is an OUTDOOR corridor property. The breakfast was adequate, fewer choices than other properties, but waffle maker was a nice addition to usual cold cereals, Danish, breads. I would give this property a 70/100 overall and a 75/100 for value. An average property at best.

Reviews.Title: “Our first time to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ljwChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: We were there for our son's graduation from the USMC Boot Camp at the MCRD. Being the first time to San Diego, the front desk staff were all very accomodating and knowlegable about the area. Susanna at the front desk was just absolutely fantastic with our requests and questions. You have a GEM in Susanna

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Timothy10-28-2011
Reviews.Content: my wife and I came out for our son's graduation from USMC Boot Camp. The staff at LQ is wonderful - they provided all the info we needed about getting on MCRD and about the family day and graduation. The room was nice. If there is anything to complain about it's that the room for breakfast was a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Charged but not given a room”
Reviews.Author: Pat J
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this location using United miles and planned to stay with my family of five after a day at Sea World. A few weeks before the trip our plans changed and I called ahead and asked to move our reservation three days back. The person on the other end of the line said she had moved our reservation and that it would not not be a problem. I wrote down the time, daye and name of the person I spoke with. However, when we arrived our reservation cold not be found. After being asked to wait 30 minutes while other guests checked in I was told I would have to pay for a new room. I went around the corner to the Western Inn and found a less expensive room with the same location and better service.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: eclectic138400
Reviews.Content: This is the best location no need to rent a car if you stay here they pick you up from the airport and bring you back the public transportation is 6 blocks away and the staff helped us except the 7-3 worker she said she was too busy checking folks out and checking folks in to go the extra mile for anyone. so get your advise from the 3-11 gal that was her specialty we had trouble with a reservation the 7-3 lady could have said too bad so sad but the guy working on the morning we had the issue took control and ta da solved it with expedia on the spot.GREAT breaskfast but get down b4 9 they have no exceptions the 7-3 gal did not budge on the matter did not bother us but late sleepers it did but rules are rules. Clean the hot tub was not real hot. but this was close to old town so if you got done for the day you could always walk up there to complete you day I would say for the adverage JOE like us not the upper class this is the deal of the day it was 89.99 plus tax the best buy in San Diago.It was very quiet.I never give anything a perfect rateing then there is no room for improvement and besides one personality it would have been perfect. .

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located for my weekend needs in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: 1PassionateTraveler
Reviews.Content: HIGHPOINTS: Walking distance to Old Town and surrounding hilly community and close to rail station. Basic Euro-style continental breakfast offerings with plenty seating space Very close to on/offramps with the 5 freeway, a big plus if you plan to be using the motel for staging point of multiday vacation (family,sightseeing) LOWS: Bad Wi-Fi signal capture - frustration and futility Parking space underground with super tight allowance, space limited, bad during peak season. No desk in room and tightly cramped Broken off temperature regulator knob in room refrigerator Bathroom could use some fixes

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Music_Traveler_PHX
Reviews.Content: Customer service was good, not extra friendly but certainly hospitable. Room was very nice with large TV, microwave and fridge. Not too much in the neighborhood but easy access to freeways and a short drive to Sea World, Zoo and beaches. Parking garage is Very Tight and there is an extra charge for parking. We booked a week in advance and I think this was a good deal for the peak summer season. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This review is ONLY for FRONT DESK service, TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsSprouter
Reviews.Content: I'll like to make it clear that we did not stay here, due to the terrible front desk service, so the review is only based on this. We made last minute reservations through Hotwire for 2 adults and 2 children. When we showed up, the lady told us that she would give us a room with a king bed. When we told her that we have children, she coldly said that's what we reserved that that's what we'd get via Hotwire. I showed her the Hotwire reservation which clearly stated 2 adults and 2 children, and the note which guarantees accommodating the number of guests reserved. She was a robot, and repeated that she could only give us a King Bed and next to the freeway (now by adding comment I take it that she aimed to make us even unhappier). She offered to upgrade us to a room for 4 if we would pay $10 extra. I showed her that in fact, the amount we got off Hotwire was only $4 less than their REGULAR rate for a room for 4 people! So that if we paid an extra $10, we would be paying MORE than the regular price and all this hassle to boot. She refused to budge and moved on to new customers. I called Hotwire immediately, and they confirmed with the hotel and found out that indeed we would not be accommodated, then offered for us to upgrade ourselves and they to reimburse us the $10. At this point, I refused to stay at the hotel with the nasty service (and extremely noisy next to the freeway) so I refused and exceptionally Hotwire gave us a refund because the hotel refused to accommodate the number of guests reserved as per their guarantee. The lady at the front desk was quite pregnant, so I give her some slack for her nasty behavior, but it was totally unreasonable that she refused to accommodate us even after Hotwire insisted that it was all part of the agreement. Kudos to Hotwire for THEIR service though - we used them again immediately and ended up paying the same price for a very nice hotel in downtown SD and so this La Quinta experience didn't entirely spoil our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Might Stay Again, With Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: janacb
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent, especially Genesis and the night manager whose name escapes me right now. The hotel is in a great location, just a few minutes drive from the airport, Sea World, the zoo, and Gas Lamp district. Old Town is a quick walk away too. Breakfast was Danishes, cereal, fruit, yogurt, eggs waffles, etc. The food was good and plentiful, and the room had lots of seating. The pool looked nice, but I didn't venture in. The outdoor seating area was lovely, great for enjoying meals outside. And that's where the fun ends. We did not get the room type we booked. Haven't checked out yet, but hopefully I'm not charged for the higher room I booked. I also requested a rollaway bed, but none were available. This was a bummer because, due to the room downgrade we now didn't have enough beds for everyone and someone had to sleep on the floor. Staff was great and provided loads of extra blankets for a makeshift bed, but still..... This hotel is not great for business travelers. I couldn't get my iPad to connect to the wifi, and while I was waiting in the lobby to use their one computer (with a 10 minute time limit) I spoke with several other guests who were having the same problem. Internet access is incredibly important when traveling these days, they need to work on that. The hair dryer was spotty which proved to be very frustrating and we were forced to spend a lot more time trying to get ready. When I was finally fed up and called the front desk it was promptly replaced with a brand new dryer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location to attractions and walking distance to Old Town”
Reviews.Author: KATS12341234
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice due to the location, free parking, secure setting, and price. The courtyard provides security for the single traveler and is within walking distance to beautiful Old Town. My granddaughter loved the warm temp of the pool and I loved the free Internet service. We would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: trace7678
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this La Quinta for five days & four nights with my wife & our four kids. Beautiful lobby & breakfast room! The hotel room had beautiful warm colors. The AC had a temperature setting & the room had a new flat screen TV. The pool was awesome & the spa was nice and hot. With us having kids, we missed breakfast. We overslept because of the drive into San Diego & the front desk lady, Grace, let us in for some food, juice, and milk. This was only 4 miles from Sea World & the San Diego Zoo. Lots of great food & shopping within walking distance. I can't stress enough the great value of this hotel! It is gorgeous & the staff is top notch. I will be back!! Thank you very much to Karina, Grace, Suzana, & the room attendants.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved it and I'll be back!!"”
Reviews.Author: pmagee
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were great and the staff were more than pleasant and helpful. My room was VERY clean and comfortable...the bed was comfy!! I was without "wheels" and I needed to be at the airport early the next morning...the shuttle driver was on time and very pleasant. Overall it was a pleasant experience and I planned to return even before I left some treasures behind and had to impose on them to get my stuff to me, which they went out of their way to do. I own a motel so I know what a pain these things can be and also how important a clean room and a comfortable bed are!!! Also only a few blocks to walk to Old Town San Diego wher I shopped and had a great dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good location right off IH 5 in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Kayaking-Flatwater
Reviews.Content: The Good: I reserved a room a month in advance asking for a quiet room for sound sleeping. Upon arrival, the staff accommodated my request and placed me in room 330. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. The bed was very comfortable. Parking: Some reviewer griped about having to pay $10.00 for the underground garage below the inn. It was convenient and served me ok. The underground parking is great if you're in a smaller vehicle. I liked it since it was secure and covered. The Not-so-Good: The hotel is right next to IH 5. That's not bad...it's just not-so-good if you're in San Diego to catch the beach front bay/ocean view. I liked the location because I could get off and on IH 5 quickly to go north or south. Continental Breakfast: It was a good breakfast selection. Coffee was hot. Milk was cold. Muffins were tasty. Eating area was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Location”
Reviews.Author: azgirl66
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here so we could attend the MCRD Graduation. It is only about a 10 minute walk to the Marine Base and there's a ton of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Room was clean and quiet. Continental breakfast was nice. The only complaint we have is the shuttle service. Not sure who they contract with, but the shuttle drivers are extremely RUDE. On family day (Thursday), we walked to the base due to the attitude the driver was displaying when picking up passengers. We did get the shuttle back to the hotel that night (because we were extremely tired) and once again, very rude and late. We had to wait about 40 minutes for them to pick us up. If our feet weren't so sore from walking around the base all day, we would walked back. The next morning we decided to walk since it is very close and we didn't want to wait around for the shuttle driver to show up with his attitude again. Other than that, the hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: kookaburra_125
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the final leg of a three week tour around California with two other friends, we can quite easily say this was the best place we stayed! The hotel is located a 10 minute walk from the Old Town Transit Centre, a walk that is perfectly safe at night, with some bars and shops along the way. The centre of Old Town itself is only five minutes away and has some fantastic places to visit. The hotel is located next to a motorway which we thought would be a problem, but we had a room which faced out on to it and it wasn't a problem. There is a really nice court yard pool and a small spa pool, we used it everyday and it was always clean and heated. At times it was difficult to dry our wet swimming shorts but wasn't a huge issue. We had the continental breakfast a couple of mornings, nothing special, exactly what you would expect; cereals, toast, fresh fruit, muffins and waffles with fruit juice, coffee etc. Staff were all really friendly and a good source of information, the reception area stock drinks and snacks which was nice and convenient. There is also a free to use PC with a printer which came in handy for printing the all important boarding passes for the flight home! Would definitely stop here if we came to San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Really Smoke Free....”
Reviews.Author: SunnyAZ2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening on Friday of Memorial Day weekend and checked in to our reserved two room suite. The bathroom smelled like a smoking lounge. I reported this to the front desk however there were no other rooms available. The only compensation offered was a $5.00 reduction in my hotel bill. The next evening there were a group of smokers in the hallway on the 3rd floor. Evidently there isn't any security or hotel personnel on site other then the front desk person. We departed the next day (a day early). There are skylights in the "living room" of the 3rd floor suites which act as a funnel for the highway noise from the outside. The air conditioner in the bedroom was able to cover most of the noise. We travel often and like to visit San Diego, however we won't return to this La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Pigwig53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really convenient to Old Town unless you want to walk several blocks uphill. The room I was given had a queen bed and the room was so small once we got our 2 suitcases in the room we couldn't walk around the bed. The carpet was damp and the air condtioning cover was off the wall. The room was so bad we decided not to stay. We were told by the front desk they had a lot better rooms but we would have to pay more. Since we had already paid the going rate - which for this hotel and location was too much, we were not incline to pay any more. Also, the front desk clerk said they added a $25.00 charge to the credit card when we initially checked in -- in case we broke something. We did get that removed before we left, but being a 60 year old woman, I was insulted that they thought -- we might break something. I have never had a hotel do anything of this sort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for MCRD graduation!”
Reviews.Author: charshoes7
Reviews.Content: Booked through SATO for Marine Boot Graduation. Excellent price and location. Shuttle for airport as well as MCRD. This worked out very nicely. Close, within walking distance, to Old Town so lots of restaurants to choose from. Hotel and room was clean. Nice breakfast buffet. Desk staff were always very helpful and shuttle drivers were informative, prompt and pleasant. Room size and bath were good size. Pleasant stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: majiksea
Reviews.Content: We like La Quinta! We find them predictable, clean, comfy, and pet friendly. This La Quinta was not clean, not comfy, and basically not fit for a dog. The trim in our room was held to the wall with masking tape, the sheet felt like plastic, and the shower was almost impossible to turn on and then was impossible to turn off because the valve was broken (glad we showered in the morning). If you have an early flight, they can't get you to the airport anyway, so stay somewhere else, anywhere else, sleep in your rental car!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kbecjeans
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay at this hotel for two nights. Due to several reviews that said it was less than La Quinta standards I was somewhat nervous about the quality we would get. But I found it to be a very nice hotel. It is an easy hotel to find and access due to its location on an on/off ramp of I-5 and near the junction of I-8. Plus it is very close to the Old Town Transit Center so buses and trolleys are readily available to take you almost anywhere in town. Also Old Town is right there and is a great place to visit for an afternoon. With plenty of restaurant choices handy we didn't feel the need to travel anywhere to eat. The checkin was easy and friendly. The hotel was clean and looked in good repair. The hotel surrounded the courtyard pool. Our room was on the freeway side, but we were not disturbed by any noise from it. The beds were great, good sheets. The bathroom was clean. About the only negative was the limited amount of shampoo. Sometimes I bring my own, but didn't this time. There really wasn't enough for both of us. The first night there seemed to be a lot of marine groups, parents and their sons and recruiters. The second night was a group of bicyclists. Which is just saying I felt comfortable with my fellow guests. The neighborhood was good enough that we felt comfortable walking to the hotel. Next door is the Courtyard by Marriott and on the other corner was a gas station and small store. Another plus is the breakfast in the morning. One day for protein there were hard boiled eggs and then next there was yogurt. Instant oatmeal, make your own waffles, a variety of sweet rolls and bread and cold cereal, along with coffee, tea, a variety of juices and milk were also offered. The breakfast room was a little small, and some people took it out to the courtyard area. There was free wifi. I also noticed a computer in the lobby which appeared to be for guest use. Parking was available, but tight. We didn't have a chance to try the pool, but I got the feeling it was not heated. While this is not a Marriott, it is certainly a good hotel and I would have no trouble staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ProudUSMCDad
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to San Diego for my youngest son's Marine Corps graduation. I wanted to be near MCRD and within walking distance of restaurants. The Old Town La Quinta suited our needs and far more! Our stay was great! The staff was friendly and responsive, the rooms were clean and comfortable. and had new, flat screen TV's. There were shuttles to the airport and to graduation, and MCRD was a only a five minute walk from the front door. There were numerous great restaurants within walking distance as well. The hotel breakfast bar provided waffles, fresh fruit and pastries, cereal or oatmeal, coffee,milk and juices. There is a great pool and hot tub in the courtyard. La Quinta was absolutely the best bang for your buck in Old Town! Many thanks and compliments to Karina and her staff!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mullisbunch
Reviews.Content: We have a large family and had two rooms for five days. The hotel is small but very clean and nice. The service is absolutely wonderful! No matter what time of day, the staff was always curteous and helpful. Any request we had was dealt with immediately. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: love_2_travel666
Reviews.Content: Set in the Old Town area this hotel hits all the buttons. Rooms are clean and tidy, with a fridge and microwave. Continental breakfast is served in the lobby but often busy so canâ€™t always get a seat. Within a short walk you are in the heart of the town where the Mexican influence is easily seen. The pool area is small and overlooked by the rooms. Although it has free wifi, this was not always available, they suggested it was our laptop...there is a desktop in the lobby for when the wifi is down. It is next to the busy I5 and although we could hear the traffic the noise from the A/C drowned it out but after a few margharitas from the Barra Barra bar it didnâ€™t affect me. The trolley tour of San Diego starts a few yards away and the Zoo is a short drive. On the other side of the Interstate is an area of restaurants and shopping if you want American style, but the local flavour has to be Old Town, you can watch the cooks making the flour tortillas, the restaurants are always busy so get there early. They ask you to reuse the towels to save water which is not a problem but what do they do with the soap? Each day we opened a pack because the one we had the day before disappeared is there a soap mountain somewhere or are they selling the used bits to the soap shop in town? They charge extra for the safe why not just add it to the room rate and be done with it. Saying that we definitely would stay here again if in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not quite up to La Quinta standards”
Reviews.Author: librarian5
Reviews.Content: This hotel had some significant pros and cons. Pros: convenient to the airport and Old Town, decent pool, nice outdoor seating, updated furnishings, pretty good price for San Diego, friendly desk staff, okay breakfast, free airport shuttle Cons: was told our room was ready at check in but walked in to find that housekeeping hadn't finished cleaning; noisy rooms (loud pipes in some rooms, freeway noise in others; ask for a quiet room); hot breakfast area (staff had to open the windows, which helped but didn't fully solve the problem); printer didn't work I expect more from La Quinta, and although the front desk staff was great and the rooms were furnished well, overall the hotel wasn't a typical La Quinta. It was more like a Days Inn -- clean and functional but no frills.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: Mariefla
Reviews.Content: We had a very large group stay here during our Spring Break. The service was wonderful, the staff was excellent, and the location to Old Town is perfect. There is a lot to do and the location is nearby everything. Karina and her staff went out of their way to help us plan our tours and dinners and we appreciated all the assistance. Breakfast is another good feature. Would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: G35_Chic
Reviews.Content: Older hotel. The bathroom had been updated and it was about the only acceptable thing about my room. The rest of my room needed an update. Old tv and old remote that most of the buttons had been worn off that I couldn't tell what button did what. The carpet in my room needed a serious carpet cleaning. I wore white socks in the room and the dirty carpets made the bottom of my socks black. The free breakfast needs improvement in the quality of food they provided. I also noticed that alot of construction type people and families with several children stayed at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family!”
Reviews.Author: bgok02
Reviews.Content: We booked this online mainly because of price. With two small children, and a bun in the oven, we were looking for places to cut expenses on our family vacation this year. We were pleasantly surprised with this property, and their super helpful and friendly staff! Yes, it's not a Hilton with all the frills and extras, but it was a nice place to stay. We stayed three nights. Overall it was clean, although the carpets could have used a good shampooing. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean and our girls loved the pool. The breakfast offered many options, and our girls got such a kick out of making their own waffles. The seating area is a bit small, and we ended up just taking our food back to our room each morning... if we would have just gotten our bust our of bed a bit earlier, that would not have been an issue. A major plus, Old Town is just a short walk away. Tons of restaurant options, unique little shops and things to see. Again, our 5 and 6 year old girls had a blast wondering around and letting out some pent up energy. Other major dining chains are in the area, only a few minutes driving time away, and a mall too. Immediate freeway access and you are off to where you need to be. We loved our stay there. The price was right, and the atmosphere was just right for our family. We will most definitely be back to this property on our next jaunt to San Diego. It was quiet and homey. We loved it! The only cons I can come up with are as follows.... but they are hardly anything. Parking: it's not plentiful in this general area. Go ahead and take the underground parking at this property... but be forewarned: it is tight! Smaller vehicles only! Eeek! LOL The carpets were on the dirty side, and I would not have let a baby crawl on it. It could have used a good shampooing. And finally, the breakfast area had limited seating. You still had access to the food, but we ended up going back to our room with breakfast each morning because we got up on the late side. Hardly anything to not consider this property over. It is great! I totally recommend it! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Old Town and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: snowtosunshine
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to San Diego, we just picked a hotel online. We couldn't have been more pleased with our choice. Our room was clean and had everything we needed. The hot tub and pool area were clean and well maintained. The complimentary breakfast had a good variety. The hotel was centrally located to the attractions and just a short walk to Old Town. But the best thing about this hotel was the staff. They were friendly, helpful in every way from giving us directions to attractions, sharing information about Old Town, to greeting us every time we came in the door. If we are back in that area of the country again, we will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: VanessaL
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in and experienced the wonderful service from Suzanna, we knew we'd made the right decision to book this hotel. Later, needing advice to find the nearest Rubio's, Karina was most helpful and kind helping us find our way around. Our room was always clean and the cleaning service was top notch. We were only here 2 days before we moved on to La Jolla where my husband had a conference. Without a doubt, will stay here again for location (nice walk to the train station), yummy places to eat by the dozens close by, shopping in Old Town near by, and just the amazing customer service offered by the first class front desk staff. Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Marine Family”
Reviews.Author: MarineParent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week for my son's Marine graduation. We got there late Tuesday night and the lady who checked us in was very nice and helpful. She signed us up for the FREE shuttle to the Marine base for both days, it was great! She also told us about all the things to do in old town, and everything is walking distance. They have great breakfast and the rooms are very clean. On Friday when we left to see our son graduate we ask for a rollaway and they had it ready for us when we got back. We had a really nice stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Mainly Okay”
Reviews.Author: Coll46
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days after Christmas 2009 here. Some of the desk staff were very helpful some didn't care. Breakfasts were appreciated. Room was clean initially - as the days past less attention to detail. Messages were not delivered and phone calls not put through. Well situated near Old Town Park. No frills inexpensive. You get what you pay for!!!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hbjill
Reviews.Content: Room was not cleaned every day, no towels and light bulbs out in room. We called many times to lobby for service and still no one came to bring towels, we had to get them ourselves and get the light bulbs as well. WOULD NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one or 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: Roccox
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel, located in the Old Town area. Although it belongs to La quinta, this specific hotel is far below other La qauinta hotels; however, for one or 2 nights is OK

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: praxis12001
Reviews.Content: Susanna and here staff at Old Town La Quinta in San Diego are the best. Stayed 5 nights in this very clean, well located hotel. Great breakfasts and very accomodating people who give excellent directions to places you want to go. Old Town is 5 minutes walk away and it is a very lively place with good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: cwilliamson2
Reviews.Content: I Would like to say I have never receive the service i got upon check in at any hotel i have stayed at the last six weeks "Veronica Rivera" upon arrivial she made myself feel so at home and it was very heart felted like she really cared about me and being comfortable. I was really impressed with her and the other staff member there. This hotel is located at 641 Camino Del Rio South San Deigo

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Extras!”
Reviews.Author: TC1968
Reviews.Content: This is a good budget option in Old Town San Diego. The dÃ©cor is a little tired and the breakfast is unspectacular, but absolutely fine. But the rooms are clean and equipped with a fridge and coffee maker and the beds are great. Thereâ€™s free internet access and staff are just great. Itâ€™s close enough to walk to a good selection of bars, restaurants and tourist attractions in San Diegoâ€™s fantastic Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mation101
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times in the last 5 years. We always feel at home. The staff is very friendly, the hotel is always clean and welcoming. They beds are very comfy with lots of pillows, and a soft duvet. The breakfast is a nice spread for a hotel like this. Hot and cold cereal, boild eggs, waffels, toast and pastries. I would recommend this place not just for the hotel but its location in Old Town, you are with-in walking distance of the red trolley, and near several restaurants in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “House Fire forces 3 week hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoNative007
Reviews.Content: It was late in the evening, our house pretty much burnt to the ground, we just got released from the hospital and we had our 2 dogs with us. Where do you go? What do you do? Thankfully, one of our neighbors was kind enough to find a hotel nearby our house that would accept dogs. We ended up staying at the Old Town La Quinta for 3 weeks before we were able to find a house to rent, and I have to say, "thank goodness for the staff"! Three weeks in a hotel is fine for vacation, but it can become difficult for everyday living with the stress of the loss of your home and total contents. However, Karina, & Susanna went above & beyond to do their best to accommodate us and make us as comfortable as possible. But we were treated no differently then any of the guests, as I noticed everyone was being accommodated per their request in the office. Our room was comfortable & clean, the breakfast always had something for everyones taste, the housekeepers were good & fast, and the groudskeeper was always doing his best to keep up with the appearance of the property. Being only blocks away from the heart of Old Town, proved to be a good distraction for us and a good option for meals. I have since reccommended this hotel to all of my out of town friends and family since our ordeal, and will continue to do so with the confidence they will very much appreciate the value and quality. Thank you, Karina & Susanna for everything!! T & C Baker-Corsello

Reviews.Title: “favorite hotel in san diego”
Reviews.Author: mike1z
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. Not only is it affordable...but the the location is great! We have never had a bad experience with this hotel. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are always clean and orderly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great customer service, one of the best i ever had.”
Reviews.Author: mnuno760
Reviews.Content: Yes there very polite and have great attitude towards guest. And heave great customer serivce i ever had. Expecially the GM is very polite and trys her best to make her customer feel comfortable while there stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, relaxing, the perfect small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marker0706
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay ! This was my 1st stay at a LaQunita Inn. A pleasant change from large resorts ,this small casual hotel had a nice pool, hot tub, shuttle to the airport, FREE WIFI, and Super freindly staff. The morning breakfast was a nice surprise with the freshest fruit, pastries, and hot waffles!! A short walk to the Old Town shopping area made this the perfect choice!! We will be back! Thank you to everyone at the Inn for making our stay so special !!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheated Again”
Reviews.Author: lookupatthesky
Reviews.Content: I've decided to start keeping track of all the hotels that cheat. They quote a rate, I ask for all other charges and I'm not including taxes here, and still, when you show up or check out there are extra charges that they insist are required. I don't care if it's a big fraud or a little fraud, it's still a fraud. And this hotel cheated us, charged us for fees that they refused to reveal in advance. So I will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience at La Quinta Inn San Diego Old Town”
Reviews.Author: Smartypants1471
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Inn San Diego (Old Town) for three nights and had a very good experience. The hotel is practically across the street from the airport, but we could not hear it. We found everything to be in order, with particularly comfortable beds. The hotel is only a few easily walkable blocks from Old Town where we found good Mexican food and a fair number of goofy touristy shops. Complimentary breakfast was good. Overall, a positive stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Perennial Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Island_Hopper2733
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we had a great experience here last summer and they did not let us down. Friendly, helpful staff, great FREE breakfast, in-room coffee. Walk to Old Town, 2 miles from Sea World. Sparkling pool, immaculate room, comfortable bed. We will always stay here when we go to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Basic Room at a Reasonable Price - Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: colmmoo
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel in the evening and found it easily. It is right off the highway. The area is pretty isolated from the rest of the city being that it's very near the airport. The street that it's on is pretty dark and there are no mini-marts within walking distance. I don't think that it was dangerous, just an isolated street. I certainly wouldn't walk around as there's nothing really close to it that I can remember. Reception was very friendly. We got to our room - it was in great shape was neat and clean - didn't look rundown. There was a slight musty smell at the writing desk - probably whatever rag they used to clean it. The rest of the room was okay. The safe was not working so we had to hide any of our electronics when we went out for dinner. This hotel is great if you need a place to stay for one night. It's very close to the airport so if you're arriving late and leaving the next day, it works out well. Parking was not free but only cost $8 for the night. The continental breakfast that was available in the morning was more than what I had expected. I was expecting to just see some cold muffins, some bread and stale coffee that's been standing around. Instead, there is a room with tables and chairs in it where you can sit down to eat. There is a waffle station where you make your own waffles using a special machine complete with a measuring cup for batter, breads, bagels (there's a toaster), danishes, muffins, coffee and tea. You need to drive a small distance to get to some fast food places.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for price”
Reviews.Author: Kildare5
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel. We were there for July 4th weekend with 2 small kids. Location wise, this hotel is probably perfect. About 10 minutes walk to the Old Town restaurants and shops and the Trolley. Hotel was ok. Room was as requested, 2 double beds. Clean, ok size for 4. Could have used a bit more space tho. Walls are paperthin. You can hear everything in rooms on either size especially the bathroom. Breakfast was average hotel fare. We got enough to eat each day. The biggest problem was the dining area. It was really too small for the amount of people staying. You were lucky if you got a table. People were sitting out by the pool, even on the wall. The queues for the bagel toaster and waffle maker were ridiculous. One morning there was at least 15 waiting. The pool is small and only has 4 loungers. Was fine the first day we got there, only us there, but busy after that. It was supposed to close at 10.30pm but doesnt. So people (mainly kids) were still in there until 12am or 1pm, even 3am one night. We were on the ground level and were lucky I guess that we weren't around the pool. One room is 2 foot from the spa. If you go to this hotel, I would ask for 2nd or 3rd floor room or definitely one away from pool area. Its not one that I will go back to quickly.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Coldgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Quinta Old Town for 3 nights. We arrived late and I was a little concerned that we were staying in a somewhat seedy place. It was very quiet and it did not look that great. Smelled a little funky too. They do need to address the odor whatever it is. I think it is cleaning product? Front desk help was very nice, helpful. They explained everything to us such as breakfast, pool hours, dining options in the area, ect. We then went to our room. A king, freeway side. At first I thought no way! We will never sleep. It does seem loud at first but you really don't notice it unless the window is wide open. We just kept our window closed and we slept just fine. The bed was great. Nice sheets and lots of pillows. Room is a little small but fine for 2 adults. In the morning, I got up and things seemed a lot better, business travlers, older couples. Breakfast was weak, just your average hotel fare. What we liked most was location to trolley and dining. This place in my opinion was really pretty clean. Pool and spa were fine, no problems, and a nice treat after lots of walking. For the price it was pretty good. I would stay again if I got a good deal. $100 or less is what I would consider a good deal. The DoubleTree next door looked really nice, dining within 2 blocks, trolley about a 10 minute walk. Some homeless guy was hanging around the side if the building on 2 different occasions, but this is common sight in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located”
Reviews.Author: nanceLondon
Reviews.Content: i was touring California last summer for a month and needed a reasonable place to stay in San Diego. I found La quinta thanks to tripadvisor forum and was pleased with the booking. I stayed a couple of nights at La Quinta Old Town in San Diego. It was only a short walk to the old town which is lovely. Also there are a few tour buses going from 5 minutes away. The hotel was clean and the room was very simple but the price was very reasonable. There are few restaurants and bars around. The hotel is close to the main road to main town san diego but it was not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: MissChris
Reviews.Content: We were in town visiting family and we needed a place big enough for all the baby stuff we have to bring with us. The room was a good size, the bed was comfortable with nice sheets. They might be in the process of changing out the towels because some were soft and fluffy and some were the usual sandpaper hotel towels. The smell of whatever cleaner they use is really bad, we had to have the window open most of the time. It's worse in the hallway than in the room, but it's still bad. Also, this hotel is literally on the freeway on ramp, not exactly relaxing. Next time I stay in Old Town, I'll stay at the Holiday Inn Express or the Hacienda

Reviews.Title: “Great visit!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location on business and found it to be great. Easy access onto Interstate 5 and and airport. The hotel and room were clean and quaint. Parking was free (though the underground slots were small) but I always found a place to park. Staff was very friendly. Plenty of options on the continental breakfast. Nice pool and hot tub. Overall, great!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: amanillda
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights and had a great time. The check in was very easy and the front desk staff was very helpful. The room was clean and there was an over abundance of towels. We were within walking distance to some great restaurants in Old Town. The parking garage was a little tight but there were enough spaces. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: phazerbro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night last week of September. I was alone so I got a decent rate ($79) on a smaller room with a queen. It was in a corner so it had a different layout than others here. The TV (very few channels) was off to the side and the room was quite small. No place really to put a suitcase! There was no closet!! Only a freestanding 5' high unit to hang a few clothes in. The room was next to the freeway, and the road noise was troublesome at times. But my biggest complaint was the small size of the breakfast area. There was about 4-5 tables, and they were all taken, with no place left to sit. I ate in my room which luckily wasn't far away. The parking garage is a little tight as others mentioned, but it's ok, I felt my car was safe there, and it kept the car off the street and out of the hot sun. But there were also good things here. The price was a fair value for the area, the pool was clean and inviting. The spa was clean and warm, and the bed was very comfortable. The room was clean and looked just fine. It was an easy walk to old town area ..about 4 blocks away and it seemed safe enough. I felt fine there. The location in general isn't bad for seeing the rest of the sights in San Diego. Very easy access to I-5 once you learn the route to and from the Old Town exit. The customer service was fine, no problems there.. so I would probably stay again if just for a night or two ... but I would ask for a larger room away from the freeway side, and pay the extra. I stayed the next 4 nights at the Marriot Old Town only 2 blocks away, and that was luxurious compared to this (see my review) but at twice the cost.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: karen99403
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the La Quinta in August of 2007 for a wedding. The reception was across the street at another hotel, but the La Quinta was half the price for a room. The La Quinta also had a refrigerator and a microwave in the room, which the competition did not. We used the courtyard in the center of the hotel to play cards and eat the continental breakfast, which was step above the usual fare. There were bagels, sweet rolls, fruit, cereal, juice and coffee. The competition across the street didn't include breakfast in their price. We did not use the pool, but it looked like a lot of fun. The staff at the hotel was very pleasant all the way around. Old Town San Diego is a very pleasant walk from the La Quinta. I hope everyone is in the mood for Mexican food. There is not much else available in the area. We decided not to rent a car for the short time we were going to be there with free time, but that did limit our dining choices. We did take the time for a visit to the San Diego Zoo. It is a must see for anyone traveling to the city. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Alison T
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on-line several months before our visit and when we arrived at around 7pm we were told that the hotel was over-booked. We had booked a room with two queen beds and were told the only room they had available was a king room and the girl on front desk suggested our two children slept on the floor! Not a good first impression! In the end, my husband and son slept in a room which was listed for repair as the bathroom was broken. We were moved to another room for our second night's stay and had a much better experience. But it was inconvenient to have to pack all our stuff up to move. It was our first experience of staying in a La Quinta Inn and sadly will probably be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfy and affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Pam054
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Super clean and comfortable as well as affordable. Easy onto the highway and quick walk to Old Town. Very friendly and accomodating staff. No other choice for me in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Coming back Soon!”
Reviews.Author: Urban_Tourista
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over a year ago for our 1 year anniversary and loved it. We had wanted to stay closer to downtown but this was by far the best value around. To our surpirse we discovered Old Town San Diego. How perfect for a romantic weekend. At Check in the clerk was very helpful, giving us maps to points of interest directions to the Zoo for our trip the next day, very friendly. Our room was a smoking room due to being the only available room, but I would've never been able to tell, there was no odor or scent of a cigarette at all. The bed was so perfect I had to see who made it. Unfortunetly they we're not available outside of hotel chains. Either way everything looked clean and neat, everything in it's place, no stains or bad smells as one would think. The pool was clean and refreshing after a long walk in the beautiful little Old town which happen to be litteraly 3 blocks away! No kidding! We actually never even made it to Downtown San Diego, no need with a cute little town up the street. Overall we had a pleasant stay here

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: irah
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Found the hotel to be as advertised. We thought that it was slightly pricey for the class of hotel, but as it is summer we figured that accounted for the higher rates. Pros: Easy walk (< than 5mins) to Old Town attractions. Easy on/off access to I-5 Easy access to downtown San Diego. Cons (Nothing much to really complain about): Basement parking slightly tight, but we found enough free spaces every night. Carpets slightly dirty, could be fixed with a shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: LindaKBT
Reviews.Content: Bathroom exceptionally clean, recently renovated--very tasteful decor. Beds were comfortable--lots of fluffy pillows. Loved the location: close to the airport, short walk to Old Town, restaurants and shops. Quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: tierra373
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the first night and last night of a trip we took to San Diego and Baja California. We chose this hotel due to its close proximity to the airport. We had two VERY different experiences. The first night, the staff at the front desk didn't know how to use the computer to check us in and we were given a musty room with a window facing the freeway. It was noisy from traffic. The lock on the door was broken and the bathroom was moldy. The room seemed very old and not taken care of. However, when we returned 4 nights later, we were pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff was competent and gave us a coupon for a nearby restaurant and a map of the area. Our room, facing the pool and courtyard, was large and clean. I would recommend this hotel with reservation. You should request a room on the courtyard side rather than the freeway side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So Convenient and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights May 2007, selecting La Quinta Inn based on reviews on TA and after extensive searching. We wanted location, value, clean and well managed, ease of access. We drove down to San Diego from LA (LAX), using Google Maps to enter our car rental address at LAX and the La Quinta Inn address in San Diego printed the instructions and maps. This worked GREAT and as a result cut our driving time and we drove right up into the parking lot. We received a rate of $107.96 USD booking on-line. We received the room we ordered on-line, which was clean, well appointed, and quiet. We heard no traffic. The room was a good 3***, though toiletries were very basic. The continental breakfast, while basic was adequate - fresh fruit, juices, cereal. muffins etc. - coffee to go etc. They have a pool and hot tub, quite nice, and we used it for an hour and enjoyed ourselves poolside over a bottle of wine. There is ample underground parking. They also have a coin laundry, which we used that was very clean. Front Desk and cleaning staff were very friendly and provided recommendations for a vibrant Mexican restaurant, which we enjoyed. This Inn is off the freeway and within 2 easy walking blocks to â€œOld Townâ€�- which is full of great restaurants and shops. We would stay in this Inn anytime and consider it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: joshbash
Reviews.Content: Very convenient place, walking distance to Old Town, a great area to go with kids. The hotel was clean, easy free parking, close to I-5 and I-8, friendly, decent continental breakfast. The bed was great. Not much in the way of views and no place to log on to internet. But I'd rate it above average and a good value for about $100.00 per nfght.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff and recently remodeled inside,”
Reviews.Author: ihave2dogs
Reviews.Content: This hotel has recently been remodeled inside which includes nice upgrades such as..granite counters in the bathroom, new bathtub liners, designer carpets and the BEST pillow top beds I have ever slept in. We were all raving about the beds! The staff and service went way beyond to please our soccer team of girls by opening up breakfast service 1 hour before the usual time to accomodate our early game time. This is a small hotel with a pool in the middle. What has not been refurbished is the pool which was always heated and warm...even the jacuzzi...The kids had lots of fun. Also need to be refurbished was the verandas of the second and third floors.. (which by the way...the 3rd floor scared me as it 's vernada slopes downward with no supports ...all I could think of was "earthquake hazard" It is freeway close, easy walking distance to "Old Town", includes usage of washer and dryers on third floor, has ice and vending machines as well. The negative to me was the small underground parking of the hotel. The spots are tight and us soccer parents with big SUV's had a hard time fitting into the stalls. It was doable..but very tight getting in and out. Dont overlook this hotel. We were quite please with what we got for such an economical price.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn San Diego Old Town / Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2380 Moore Street, San Diego, CA 92110
